text: The Buddh International Circuit (or BIC) is a track (circuit) that had opened in 2011, which is used for motor racing. The main event is the Indian Grand Prix, the first to be held in that country. The track was designed by Hermann Tilke, the FIA's most commonly used Track Designer. The track was originally known as the Jaypee Group Circuit, after the owners, the Jaypee Group. The track was renamed in April 11, 2011 == References == Category:Formula One circuits Category:Formula One current Category:2011 establishments in Asia Category:2010s establishments in India
title: Buddh International Circuit
